{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks about statements about tRNA molecules. The statement that says 'The amino acid attachment is always to 3' end of the molecule.' is false because it is mentioned in the paper 'Energy cost of proofreading to increase fidelity of transfer ribonucleic acid aminoacylation' that misacylated molecules are hydrolyzed more rapidly than correctly acylated molecules, which means the attachment can occur at other positions. Therefore, option C is the false statement.", "answer_choice": "C"}
